title: Wildfires in Chile Kill 19 and Force 50
snippets: The wildfires force 50,000 people to flee, as President Gabriel Boric declares emergency.

Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile on Sunday left at least 18 people dead, scorched thousands of acres of forest and destroyed hundreds of homes, authorities said, as the South American country swelters under a heat wave.
Chilean President Gabriel Boric declared a state of catastrophe in the country’s central Biobio region and the neighboring Ñuble region.

One mayor pleaded with the national government for help as flames destroyed entire neighborhoods in the southern region of Biobío.
Uncontrolled wildfires tore through communities in southern Chile, leaving charred ruins in their wake and at least 19 dead, authorities said, announcing the latest toll on Sunday.

summary: Wildfires in central and southern Chile have killed at least 19 people, destroyed hundreds of homes, and forced 50,000 residents to evacuate. President Gabriel Boric declared a state of catastrophe in the Biobío and Ñuble regions as firefighters continue to battle the flames.

title: At Least 39 Dead in Southern Spain High Speed Train Collision
snippets: At least 21 people were killed, and 100 more were injured after a collision between two high-speed trains in southern Spain on Sunday, according to officials.

Spanish police said Monday that at least 39 people died in the a high-speed train collision Sunday in southern Spain and rescue efforts were continuing.

Los Angeles is the only of the four teams left standing to have played for the NFL’s championship this decade, taking home the Lombardi Trophy in 2022. Before that, the Patriots last played in the Super Bowl in 2019, the Seahawks in 2015 and the Broncos in 2016. Once the dust settled on Sunday’s action, the NFL...
The Patriots fended off the Texans and the Rams beat the Bears in overtime to wrap up the divisional round of the playoffs on Sunday.
The 2025-26 NFL postseason is down to four teams remaining.
